summary: This document is a chain of email correspondence regarding a proposal from CACI INC. for scanning services related to the USAO SDNY case US v. Maxwell Epstein. The emails discuss contingency planning, as a Florida vendor is the primary option, with CACI as a backup. The communication is between US Attorney's Office (USAO) personnel and a CACI contracts administrator.

connections.description: They are communicating via email within the context of the USAO SDNY, coordinating on the procurement of scanning services for the Maxwell Epstein case.
I, a CACI contracts administrator, is submitting a service proposal to M, presumably a USAO SDNY official, for case-related scanning work.

events.title: CACI Proposal Submission
events.description: CACI INC. submits a proposal for scanning services to the USAO SDNY for the case US v. Maxwell Epstein.

events.title: Contingency Planning for Case Scanning
events.description: USAO SDNY personnel discuss via email the status of a primary Florida vendor for scanning and authorize a backup contract with CACI in case the primary vendor fails.

locations: USAO SDNY (U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York)
Oklahoma City, OK 73127 (CACI INC. - Federal Shared Services Center address)
keyFacts: The USAO SDNY was procuring scanning services for the case US v. Maxwell Epstein as of March 2021.
A Florida-based vendor was the primary choice for the scanning work, with CACI INC. engaged as a contingency backup.
The email chain reveals procedural and logistical planning within the prosecution team for handling case evidence/documentation.
